components.description: A horizontal line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing left and right.
components.title: Left Right Arrow

description: A horizontal line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing left and right.
title: Left Right Arrow

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: A horizontal line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing left and right. Left-right Arrow was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under  http://emojipedia.org/left-right-arrow/
emoji_net_data.name: left-right arrow

bn:00104328a: Perpendicular to the vertical; parallel to the plane of the horizon; level, flat.
Parallel to or in the plane of the horizon or a base line
Parallel to or in the plane of the horizon or a base line.
Parallel to the plane of the horizon.

bn:00053450n: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).
